org.gearvrf

Class GVRRenderTextureArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTexture
        • org.gearvrf.GVRRenderTexture
          • org.gearvrf.GVRRenderTextureArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRAndroidResource.Callback<GVRImage>, GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback<GVRImage>, GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback

    public class GVRRenderTextureArray
extends GVRRenderTexture
    A render texture array is an array of textures which may be rendered into. All of the textures in the array must be the same size. The GVRRenderTextureArray object is used internally for shadow mapping. All of the shadow maps are kept in a single layered texture.
    See Also:
    GVRShadowMap, GVRRenderTexture

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRRenderTextureArray

        public GVRRenderTextureArray(GVRContext ctx,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             int samples,
                             int layers)
        Create a layered texture array. The GPU memory for the textures is not allocated here. It will be created in the GL thread the first time the texture array is used for rendering.
        Parameters:
        ctx - GVRContext to associate the texture array with.
        width - pixel width of textures in the array.
        height - pixel height of textures in the array.
        samples - number of MSAA samples
        layers - maximum number of textures in the array.
